text: Leonidas Howard Sr. (1849 – March 8, 1912), usually known as Leon Howard, was an African-American laborer from Memphis, Tennessee (apparently an ex-slave) who served one term as a Republican member of the Tennessee House of Representatives for the 43rd General Assembly (1883–84). He later moved to Bakersfield, California. "Leonidas (Leon) Howard," This Honorable Body: African American Legislators in 19th Century Tennessee. Tennessee State Library and Archives. He died at his home in Bakersfield on March 8, 1912. ==References== Category:Members of the Tennessee House of Representatives Category:African-American state legislators in Tennessee Category:1849 births Category:1912 deaths Category:Tennessee Republicans Category:People from Bakersfield, California Category:People from Memphis, Tennessee Category:19th- century American politicians Category:African-American politicians during the Reconstruction Era Category:American slaves Category:American freedmen
